column4: One question: if I download portable apps like Eclipse IDE, where is a good place to put these stuff?
why not just use the repository version?
it's not installed by default, but you can always install it from the repository
you can use as many apt managers as you like (apt-get, synaptic, aptitude, usc), just try not to have more than 1 *running* at the same time (they *should* lock each other out safely though)
